quest.name: High Importance, Low Urgency
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Nashrifhal wants to help their fellows at the Great Work, but can't do it alone.
objectives: /greet the alchemists and ask them what they need.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: Hello there, adventurer! Can you help me? I need someone to go around and see if anyone is wanting for supplies.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: I would do it myself, but we alchemists are all so busy that no one wants to bother each other with selfish requests. But if an outsider like you asks, they just might open up a bit.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: Please. I need to start restocking, but at this rate I'll never know what needs replenishing. I would really appreciate your help.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: Thank you! I should mention that it might be a bit difficult to get some of the workers' attention. Everyone is exhausted, so make sure to greet them to get them out of their heads.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: I'm sure everyone has something they need. They just won't tell me what. Can you talk to them for me? You might need to greet them first if they don't notice you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: She doesn't seem to notice you. Perhaps if you greet her first, she will respond.

dialogue.name: MAHRUVVET
dialogue.text: Apologies, I was malms away. Is there something I can do for you?

dialogue.name: MAHRUVVET
dialogue.text: Hm... Now that you mention it, I'm running low on serpent's root. It has all sorts of medicinal uses, so I feel I can never have enough.

dialogue.name: MAHRUVVET
dialogue.text: I still have some stock left, but you never know what might come up. It certainly couldn't hurt to have some extra.

dialogue.name: MAHRUVVET
dialogue.text: I still have some serpent's root left, but I can never have too much.

dialogue.name: JALAMUC
dialogue.text: My tea is nearly done, which means I can...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They're caught up in their work. You may need to greet them to get their attention.

dialogue.name: JALAMUC
dialogue.text: Oh! Terribly sorry. It wasn't my intention to ignore you. Can I help you?

dialogue.name: JALAMUC
dialogue.text: Well, since you ask, I am ever wanting for more tea and milk! A nice cup of chai is just what my body and mind need to unwind after a few sleepless nights of work.

dialogue.name: JALAMUC
dialogue.text: It isn't something I can readily ask for, seeing as it isn't strictly a necessary medicinal ingredient. I know that seeing to your own well-being is essential to producing quality work, but I just can't bring myself to be so selfish.

dialogue.name: JALAMUC
dialogue.text: It would be nice to have some more tea and milk to help relax.

dialogue.name: SAJAVAAZ
dialogue.text: Hrm... Erhhh...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: He's grumbling something to himself. He may take notice after you greet him.

dialogue.name: SAJAVAAZ
dialogue.text: Hmmm? Oh, what's the matter with me? Nearly fell asleep... Sorry about that. Did you need to speak with me?

dialogue.name: SAJAVAAZ
dialogue.text: Let me think... There are no alchemical components I need at the moment. But I could stand to have some nonperishables on hand.

dialogue.name: SAJAVAAZ
dialogue.text: I end up skipping meals because I'm too busy with work, so something nutritionally dense that I can eat one-handed while I work would be a lifesaver. If there's foodstuff like that, I'll take as much as I can get.

dialogue.name: SAJAVAAZ
dialogue.text: I would really like something quick and nutritious to eat. Preferably something I can eat with one hand while I work.

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: You're back! What did everyone ask for?

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: I had a hunch you'd be able to get more out of them than me. None of these requests are particularly unexpected, but...the only nonperishable food I think we can get is pickles, and that doesn't sound quite like what he wanted...

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: I do want to make sure everyone is eating properly. I know they all rely on their medicine to get them by when they're too busy to eat. I wonder...

dialogue.name: NASHRIFHAL
dialogue.text: I'll ask a friend of mine from Sharlayan if there's anything to be done. Anyway, that's a problem for me to think about, not you. Thank you for your help!
